result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale R Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Dale R Berry was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dale R Berry is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Dale R Berry was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.  Balance refunded to poster.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha

No violent contact with any family members.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - regular
  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Exhibits #2-10, 14, 4a, 5a, 6a, 7a, 9a   Exhibits #1, 11, 12 & 13 & 15 (DVD's) non-scannable
Sentencing hearing on July 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
verdict forms (4 signed, 4 unsigned)
Alternate juror selected for case

Defendant Dale R Berry in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for Day 3 of jury trial at 8:45 a.m. State burned CD/DVD of annotated exhibits 4, 5, 6, 7 & 9 which hard copies were marked as State's exhibits #4a, 5a, 6a, 7a & 9a.  Court receives those exhibits.  Defendant states he does not elect to testify in his own defense.  Court performs colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to testify.  Defendant states he will not be testifying.  Court addresses jury instructions with counsel.  Attorney Hulgaard submits a supplement she wishes to have added to some instructions.  Parties go through instructions and state withdraws its request to add supplement to instructions.  Jurors enter courtroom at 9:00 a.m.  Sidebar. Court gives jury instructions at 9:05 a.m.  Closing statements/arguments by the state.  Closing statements/arguments by Attorney Martinez.  Additional statements made by the state.  Final instructions given to the jury.  Clerk announces alternate juror - David M. and court dismisses him (10:37 a.m.) Clerk swears in civilian bailiff.  Jurors begin deliberations at 10:38 a.m.  Court addresses issues and gets contact information for parties.  Court adjourns at 10:45 a.m.

Jurors reach verdict at 11:20 a.m.   Case called at 11:38 a.m.  Jurors enter courtroom at 11:40 a.m.  Court reads verdicts.  Jury finds the Defendant Not Guilty on Counts 1, 2 & 3 and Guilty on Count #4.  Court polls the jury.  State moves to enter judgment on Count #4.  Court enters judgment on Count #4.  Court sets sentencing date.

Defendant Dale R Berry in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Michele W. Hulgaard and Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for Day 2 of jury trial at 8:55 a.m.  State's exhibit #12 is marked.  State moves for admission of Exhibits #2-9.  Attorney Martinez does not object.  Court receives Exhibits #2-9.  State moves for admission of Exhibits #12 & 13.  Court receives Exhibits #12 & 13.  Jurors enter courtroom at 9:01 a.m.  Deputy Moglia is sworn-in and testifies.  Exhibits #4-9 shown to the jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Martinez.  Christine J. is sworn-in and testifies.  Cross-examination by Attorney Martinez.  State plays DVD of jail phone calls (State's Exhibit #11) for the jury.  Court takes short break at 10:13 a.m.    Court reconvenes at 10:30 a.m.  State informs the court that its last witness is not available until 11:00 a.m.  Court adjourns so state's witness can get here.  Court reconvenes at 11:24 a.m.  Jurors enter courtroom at 11:25 a.m.  Deputy Tim Loberg is sworn-in and testifies.  State's Exhibit #14 is marked.   State plays DVD (Exhibit #12).  State continues with direct examination of witness.  Cross-examination by Attorney Martinez.  Re-direct by the state.  Re-cross-examination by Attorney Martinez.  State rests.  Court excuses jury at 12:24 p.m. to take care of some issues with counsel.  Attorney Martinez moves for dismissal of Count #1 & 2.  State makes statements/responses regarding request for dismissal.  Court denies request.  Attorney Martinez is not sure if Defendant will testify.  Jurors enter courtroom at 12:30 p.m.  Court dismisses jurors for the day at 12:33 p.m. and orders jurors to return at 8:30 a.m. tomorrow, 5/12/16 to continue with trial.  Court discusses jury instructions with parties.  State moves for admission of Exhibits #11 & 14.  Court receives Exhibits #11 & 14.  Court adjourns at 12:47 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Voir Dire list
Random Listing Report - Voir Dire

Defendant Dale R Berry in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Michele W. Hulgaard and Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for 12-person jury trial.  Court addresses motion to adjourn filed by Attorney Martinez on 5/9/16.  Attorney Martinez makes statements regarding his request as well as motions in limine.  State makes statements/response to request for adjournment.  Attorney John Marchan is present in the courtroom.  Court does not see any basis to adjourn trial today and denies motion to adjourn.  Attorney Martinez requests a brief adjournment to speak with Defendant.  Court adjourns so Attorney Martinez can speak with Defendant.   Court reconvenes at 9:30 a.m.  Attorney Martinez states they are ready to proceed.   Court addresses motions in limine.  Parties agree and court orders that portion of custodial DVD that Defense requests to be redacted will be redacted for the jury.  State brings up some timing issues regarding witnesses.  Attorney Martinez makes statements/responses.  Deputy Wearing makes statements regarding issue of his report.  Attorney Martinez states he does not wish to proceed until he has report from Deputy Wearing.  State makes comments/responses.  Court adjourns so officer can try to obtain report.  Court reconvenes at 10:30 a.m.  Deputy Wearing was not able to produce a report.  Attorney Martinez makes statements regarding issue of no report.  State makes statements.  Court will prohibit the state from calling Deputy Wearing due to unavailability of his report.  Attorney Martinez is requesting an alternate juror.  Court grants request.  Jurors are called for at 10:45 a.m.  Jurors arrive at 11:18 a.m.   Clerk swears in potential jurors on voir dire.  Court gives some preliminary instructions and introductions.  Court conducts voir dire.  State conducts voir dire.  Attorney Martinez conducts voir dire.  Sidebar.  Court strikes Paul S. and Michelle M. for cause.  Clerk announces next 2 potential jurors.  Court strikes Patricia M. for cause.  Clerk announces next potential juror.  Jurors are excused temporarily at 1:02 p.m. to conduct individual voir dire on one of the potential jurors.  State advises court that it will just use that juror as its last peremptory strike.  Jurors enter courtoom at 1:05 p.m.  Parties practice peremptory strikes - 4 strikes each.  Clerk announes 12 jurors and 1 alternate juror selected to try the issues.  Remaining non-selected jurors are dismissed at 1:15 p.m.  Clerk swears in selected jurors to try the issues, as well as 1 alternate juror.  Court gives some instructions to jurors and breaks for lunch at 1:18 p.m..  Jurors and all parties are ordered to return at 2:30 p.m. to commence with trial.  Court orders sequestration of witnesses upon commencement of trial.  Court adjourns for lunch at 1:22 p.m. 

Case called at 2:30 p.m.  Jurors enter courtroom at 2:33 p.m.  Court gives jurors preliminary instructions.  State's exhibits #1-10 previously marked.  Opening statements made by the state (Attorney Michael Thurston).  Opening statements made by Attorney Martinez.
Case proceeds to testimony.  Nicole M. is sworn-in and testifies.  State moves for admission of Exhibit #1.  Attorney Martinez objects.  Court receives Exhibit #1.  State moves for admission of Exhibit #10.  Court receives Exhibit #10.  Court takes short adjournment to test audio of DVD.  Jurors enter courtroom at 4:05 p.m.  State plays DVD (Exhibit #1) for the jury.  Cross-examination by Attorney Martinez.  Sidebar.  Re-direct by the state.  A.N.B. is sworn-in by Judge Carter.  State (Attorney Thurston) questions A.N.B..  No cross-examination by the defense.  S.L.B.  is sworn-in by Judge Carter.  State (Attorney Thurston) questions S.L.B.  No cross-examination by the defense.  Court adjourns until tomorrow, 5/11/16.  Jurors are ordered to return at 8:15 a.m.  Jurors are dismissed for the evening at 5:05 p.m.  State requests rule of sequestration to remain.  Court grants request.  Court adjourns.
(Orig.) ... for adjournment of jury trial. Filed by Atty Martinez.
filed by Attorney Nicholas Martinez

Defendant Dale R Berry in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Martinez states he is ready to proceed to trial on Tuesday, 5/10/16 but makes statements/comments regarding witnesses.  Attorney Martinez files motion in limine.  Motions in limine to be heard on Tuesday morning, 5/10/16 before having jurors brought up.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury trial remains on as #1 trial.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with family members. No physical discipline of any of his children. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. NOTE:  $2,500.00 was posted - $1,000.00 to be returned to poster.

Defendant Dale R Berry in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for bail motion hearing.  Attorney Martinez makes statements regarding his request for bail reduction.  State objects to any bail modification.  Court grants request and modifies/reduces bail.  Court sets jury status and jury trial date.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
